name: Malaria dashboard web and mobile app
description: The Malaria Dashboard app is a software application developed by the PMI MEASURE Malaria project with the aim of providing a user-friendly mobile dashboard at the peripheral level aimed at improving the ability of health workers to analyze and use data for decision making. decision. This application is available in two versions: A web version which is presented as a DHIS2 application for the central level This version of the Malaria Dashboard application can be installed as an additional module of the DHIS2 (District Health Information Software v2). It makes it possible to install a Malaria metadata package inspired by the work carried out in this direction by the WHO and the MEASURE Evaluation project in DHIS2 while generating a simplified dashboard designed to be accessible to health personnel at the decentralized level. A mobile version available for Android and IOS for the decentralized level This version of the Malaria Dashboard application can be installed on Android or IOS mobile terminals allowing connection to the country's DHIS2 application to download and make data available offline on malaria of the health structure concerned in order to allow analysis and decision-making without the need for an Internet connection.

SDGs.evidenceText: By presenting malaria data in a digest and accessible dashboard (Mobile and web) the application promotes good health and wellbeing of the citizens. The decision makers have a tool to help take inform decisions.
Malaria indicators presented by the app are desegregated by gender and age to help promote equity..
The app uses innovative approach to allow the use of mobile devices in area with poor internet connectivity and still allow them analyse malaria data for decision making.
